profile_positions.description:
IT Innovation lead in the newly formed Philips Domestic Appliances company

Responsible for the successful separation of the IT departments of Domestic Appliances and Royal Philips.
Responsible for preparing and managing the Day 1 (after July 1st 2021) architecture for I2M, and ensuring proper temporary SLA support from Royal Philips until Day 2 (standalone infrastructure)
Responsible for the Design and Implementation of the Day 2 (new) IT architecture for the I2M domain (R&D, Design, Intellectual Property & Standards and Group Sustainability)
Responsible for defining the I2M IT Operating Model for Day 2, including the sourcing model, capabilities needed, and (internal) workforce design
IT Business Partner to the heads of R&D, Design, Intellectual Property & Standards, and Group Sustainability
Team lead for the IT I2M department and member of the IT Leadership Team of Domestic Appliances
profile_positions.title: Platform Lead I2M (Idea to Market) Domestic Appliances - IT Innovation Lead

profile_positions.description:
As a program manager in the M2O (Market to Order) domain I am responsible for the deployment of Salesforce.com (SFDC) in the markets, particularly for the business of Oral Healthcare, and establishing a sales excellence process based on SFDC Einstein, Quip and Trailhead. Enforcing that the delivery and operations teams work together to ensure stable releases meeting the product owner needs.

Furthermore I am part of the (IT) disentanglement team that will see two legal entities out of the split between Royal Philips and Domestic appliances on July 1st 2021. In this team I am responsible for the separation of the Market to Order applications (Icon, SFDC and Anaplan), setting up the new Customer EDI communications in the markets, ensuring that there is a proper separation strategy for over 300 local applications, and a Day 1 (legal separation day) IT Architecture, and infrastructure in place. I work as a SPOC for the LDTs (Local Dissentanglement Teams), and report to the head of the program in the IT department.
profile_positions.title: IT Program Manager M2O (Market to Order)

profile_positions.description:

Responsible for the process that leads to the self billing of €11M per month in payments to partners.

profile_positions.description:
Part of the IT governance team, my role entails the following responsibilities:

- Working with the CIO, Heads of IT and cross-functional teams to execute strategic projects within the IT organization including coordinating teams and leading specific deliverables.
- Teaming up with the Governance team to ensure tight alignment between the strategic objectives of IT and how we are managing and measuring the IT organization’s performance.
-Conducting analysis and develop materials to support leadership decision-making on strategic topics relating to people, process or technology.
-Bringing the IT story to life through engagement and communication activities in cooperation with the Visibility and Engagement team.
-Preparing monthly IT Leadership meetings including setting the agenda, organizing internal or external speakers or site visits and managing follow-up actions.
-Facilitating the exposure of the IT Leadership team and IT organization to new technologies and ways of working through collaboration with external partners and organization.
-Conducting regular research on technology and industry trends and competitors, providing regular updates to the leadership team and to the IT organization.
profile_positions.title: IT Executive Advisor

profile_positions.description:

- Prioritize IT projects/programs across the Philips Enabling Functions (Finance, HR, Procurement, Q&R, Legal, Real Estate, Sustainability and Digital) that require immediate attention from the IT Enabling Functions leadership team.

- Deploy a performance management culture in the markets by promoting the use of KPI dashboards, and Philip’s performance management tooling.

profile_positions.title: IT Portfolio Manager M2O/Markets and Enabling Functions

profile_positions.description:
Member of central team that measured and analyzed the performance of Philips’ global businesses to provide insights to Philips Exec Committee and SVB.

- Performed analytics to recognize drivers of performance across businesses, identify top-performers and facilitate the replication of success stories in lower-performing areas.
- Owned the expertise (functional ownership) in the performance management (IT) tool used in Philips globally, as well as being the center of excellence for the tool for senior stakeholders.
- Fostered an entrepreneurial and collaborative mindset between Philips HQ and the central businesses, local markets and enabling functions, to create impactful reports for their leadership.
- Created quarterly KPI dashboards for the Philips Executive Committee and Supervisory Board.

profile_positions.description:
Royal Dutch Shell (Iraq) - From The Netherlands (09/2013 - 12/2013)
Position: Master Thesis
Topic: Operations Management in post-dictatorial Iraq
Research question: How can cultural risks be anticipated, internal risks be controlled and external risks be managed, in order to achieve operational excellence, within project management, in hostile business environments?

•	Master thesis in collaboration with Royal Dutch Shell, investigating uncertainty on the deliveries of non-operational resources to their oil field in south Iraq.
•	Academic research in the areas of cultural risks, internal risks and external risks within project management
•	Interviews within Royal Dutch Shell (Iraq) and FMCG companies (Dubai) to better understand the issue of uncertainty in Iraq and find different ways to approach it.
profile_positions.title: Master Thesis at Royal Dutch Shell
